quizzes.title: History Quiz: General and Us
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, troops, snipes. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: He was commander of US forces during the Gulf War.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Norman Schwarzkopf, Jr.

questions.question: Although he was not the Allied Supreme Commander, he commanded US troops who were to land on D-Day.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Omar Bradley

questions.question: What 1979 adaptation of a Stephen King novel focuses on a writer who finds out that his fellow citizens are turning into vampires?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Salems Lot

questions.question: What film based on a novel by Anne Rice stars Tom Cruise, Brad Pitt and Kirsten Dunst?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Interview with the Vampire

questions.question: Kate Beckinsale plays Selene, the main protagonist in the Underworld series.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This US general was nicknamed Old Blood and Guts.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Patton

questions.question: He was the first general in US history.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Washington

questions.question: This US general won the Nobel Peace Prize in 1953.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George C. Marshall

questions.question: In which movie does Wesley Snipes play a half-human and half-vampire who protects humans against vampires?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blade

questions.question: He led the Union march through Georgia, burning everything in his path.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William T. Sherman

questions.question: He  led  US troops in WWI.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Pershing

questions.question: What movie stars James Woods as Jack Crow, the leader of a Catholic Church-sanctioned team of vampire hunters?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vampires

questions.question: During the American Revolutionary War he won many victories on what was then the Western frontier.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Rogers Clark

questions.question: What is the main setting of the horror movie Shadow of the Vampire, starring John Malkovich, Willem Dafoe and Udo Kier?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: an old Slovakian castle

questions.question: This US general was called Old Rough and Ready.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zachary Taylor

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Billy Wilder and General
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, paramount, fuss. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following statements about Billy Wilder is true?

options.text: He directed fourteen different actors in Oscar-nominated performances.
He grew up in Vienna and has sometimes been called The Viennese Pixie.
He won three Academy Awards for producing, directing and writing the same film.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Billy Wilder wrote five of the American Film Institutes 100 Funniest Movies, including the one judged the funniest of them all. Which was it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Some Like it Hot

questions.question: At the Battle of the Bulge, when the Germans asked for his surrender his reply was Nuts!
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anthony McAuliffe

questions.question: During WW II the German High Command thought that this US general would lead the invasion of Europe.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Patton

questions.question: Which of Billy Wilders films secured his reputation in Hollywood by gaining him Oscar nominations for Best Director and Best Writing as well as for Best Picture?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Double Indemnity

questions.question: Billy Wilder co-wrote over a dozen films with Charles Brackett. Which of these was their last writing collaboration?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sunset Boulevard

questions.question: Billy Wilder was born in what is now the territory of this country
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Poland

questions.question: Billy Wilder co-wrote many screenplays with I.A.L. Diamond. Which of these was not one of them?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Seven Year Itch

questions.question: This US general was called Old  Fuss and Feathers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Winfield Scott

questions.question: Paramount Pictures kept back part of Billy Wilders share of the profits from Stalag 17 to cover the loss made by his previous film. What was that loss-making film?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ace in the Hole

questions.question: This US general led the victorious troops at the Battle of New Orleans.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andrew Jackson

questions.question: Billy Wilder was a successful screenplay writer before he started directing. Where did he first direct a film?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paris

questions.question: He led UN troops during the early part of the Korean War but was replaced by General Ridgeway.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Douglas MacArthur

questions.question: As a writer in Berlin, Billy Wilder adapted which famous childrens book for the screen?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Emil and the Detectives

questions.question: What was the first film Billy Wilder directed in America?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Major and the Minor

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: John Cleese and Horse
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, field, john. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which one of King Lears daughters is sent into exile after she refuses to profess her love for her father?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cordelia

questions.question: At the battle of Bosworth Field, this Shakespearean character uttered the often-quoted words, A horse, a horse, my kingdom for a horse!.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard III

questions.question: John Cleeses original surname was Cheese but he had it legally changed when he was at university.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: John Cleese co-wrote the comedy series Fawlty Towers with which other member of the cast?

options.text: None - John Cleese wrote it all alone

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Connie Booth (Polly)

questions.question: This production company co-founded by John Cleese produces entertaining business training videos.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Video Arts

questions.question: Which part did John Cleese play in the BBCs Television Shakespeare series?

options.text: Petruchio in The Taming of the Shrew

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Petruchio in The Taming of the Shrew

questions.question: Which of the following statements about John Cleese is false?

options.text: A rubbish dump in New Zealand was called Mt Cleese after him.
In 1996, he became John Cleese CBE (Commander of Order of The British Empire).
A species of lemur has been named after him.
An asteroid has been named in his honour.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In 1996, he became John Cleese CBE (Commander of Order of The British Empire).

questions.question: John Cleese was elected Rector of which Scottish University?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: St. Andrews

questions.question: Foreseeing that she will never have peace of mind, this Queen of Scotland desperately asks what, will these hands nere be clean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lady Macbeth

questions.question: Which of the following has not been the subject of a television documentary by John Cleese?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fly Fishing

questions.question: John Cleese has co-written books on the psychology of family and personal life
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What country does King Lear rule according to Shakespeares famous tragedy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Britain

questions.question: Which of these films starring John Cleese were not written or co-written by him?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Clockwise

questions.question: Which character did John Cleese play in James Bond films?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: both of these

questions.question: What is the name of the proud Queen of the fairies in Shakespeares comedy A Midsummer Nights Dream?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Titania

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Requirements and Type
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, computers, fires. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the boiling point of water?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 212 Degrees Fahrenheit

questions.question: How often must composite air cylinders for self-contained breathing apparatus be tested to meet the requirements of the United States Department of Transportation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 3 years

questions.question: How often must steel and aluminum air cylinders for self-contained breathing apparatus be tested according to requirements of the United States Department of Transportation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: every 5 years

questions.question: What type of rope is used in life safety situations?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dynamic or static rope

questions.question: What measurement system is commonly used in the United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Customary System

questions.question: The three mechanisms heat can be transferred from one body to another are radiation, conduction and convection.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: A class 1-A extinguisher will extinguish twice as much fuel as 2-A extinguisher.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What type of self-contained breathing apparatus is used in fire service?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Open – Closed circuit

questions.question: What king of England, depicted in a self-titled Shakespearean play, won a decisive victory at the Battle of Agincourt during the Hundred Years War?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henry V

questions.question: What Shakespearean character had a dream that her husband Julius Caesar would die in her arms?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Calpurnia

questions.question: Mixed hot gases, during firefighting operations, can result in an explosive ignition. What is this ignition called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Backdraft

questions.question: Fires involving electrical energized equipment such as computers, household appliances and etc. are what class of fire?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: C

questions.question: Which of the following equipments is used by firefighters to protects the face and lungs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: Who revealed to Prince Hamlet of Denmark that his father was murdered in one of Shakespeares most famous tragedies?

options.text: a troop of actors who reenact the murder of King Hamlet

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: his fathers ghost

questions.question: Which of these kings, depicted by Shakespeare, was not murdered by a rival for the throne?

options.text: All of them were murdered by rivals for the throne.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: King Lear

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Meaning and Fire
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, stadium, der. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the meaning of the German word der Sekt?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the sparkling wine

questions.question: What device converts a vehicle’s 12 or 24 volt DC current into 110 or 220 volt AC current?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Inverter

questions.question: What is the meaning of the German word bald?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: soon

questions.question: What is the meaning of the German word die List?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the cunning, slyness

questions.question: During a fire, what are the most critical areas in a multistory building?

options.text: Fire/topmost floor, floor directly above the fire

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fire/topmost floor, floor directly above the fire

questions.question: What is the meaning of the German adjective komfortabel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: luxurious

questions.question: What is the meaning of the German das Gift?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the poison

questions.question: What is one of the objective of a building search during a fire?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Finding victims

questions.question: During the searching operation within a building on fire, what should the rescue personnel do?

options.text: Feel doors for excessive heat before opening them
Open doors as soon as you can
Never feel doors for excessive heat before opening them

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Feel doors for excessive heat before opening them

questions.question: What is the meaning of the German word der Herd?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the stove

questions.question: What is the meaning of the German word die Art?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the kind, manner, or type

questions.question: What is the meaning of the German verb winken?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: to wave

questions.question: What is the meaning of the German noun das Stadium?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the stage, level

questions.question: What is the meaning of the German noun das Rezept?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the recipe; prescription

questions.question: A dynamic high-stretch rope is designed for rising and lowering heavy loads.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Michael Palin and Land
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, houyhnhnms, land. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Gullivers Travels by Jonathan Swift was originally published as a fake travelogue, with Lemuel Gulliver as the author. It comprised four parts, whose titles together specify eight of the lands Gulliver visited.   Which land was a flying island that could be manoeuvred by its inhabitants?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Laputa

questions.question: Michael Palin has been honoured by having been made both a Fellow of the Royal Geographical Society (FRGS) and a Member of the Order of the British Empire (MBE)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Michael Palin was able to portray the stammering Ken in A Fish called Wanda so accurately because he himself had a bad stammer when he was a boy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Michael Palin has undertaken several epic international journeys for BBC television travel documentaries. Which was the first?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Around the World in 80 Days

questions.question: J.R.R. Tolkiens creation Middle-Earth was revealed to the public first in The Hobbit and later in the The Lord of the Rings trilogy. Which of the following is not a location in Middle-Earth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mordia

questions.question: Michael Palins interest in which famous writer inspired both a comic novel and a travel documentary?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ernest Hemingway

questions.question: Which role did Michael Palin play in Terry Gilliams film Brazil?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A government  torturer

questions.question: Anthony Hope gave us this fictional land whose name has now become synonymous with the romantic ideal of 19th century Central Europe.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ruritania

questions.question: Michael Palin has written and presented several television documentaries on art, including one on the artist Vilhelm Hammershøi. What nationality was Hammershøi?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Danish

questions.question: Michael Palin won a British Academy (BAFTA) award for his work on which film?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Fish Called Wanda

questions.question: English novelist and poet Thomas Hardy re-used Wessex -- the old name for the land of the West Saxons -- as the setting for his novels of 19th century rural life. His fictionalised locations can usually be easily identified with their real equivalents. What name did Hardy give to his real home town of Dorchester in Dorset?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Casterbridge

questions.question: Which of the following is not one of the television Ripping Yarns that Michael Palin co-wrote and starred in with Terry Jones.

options.text: Cyril and the House of Commons

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cyril and the House of Commons

questions.question: Michael Palin starred in all these films, but which of them did he also write?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Missionary

questions.question: Which of Michael Palins TV film scripts was inspired by how he met his future wife?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: East of Ipswich

questions.question: Gullivers final voyage took him to the fictional and of the Houyhnhnms where horses ruled and humans existed only as degraded brutes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True
